programme.title: Rosewater
programme.desc: In June 2009, BBC journalist Maziar Bahari, an Iranian-born Canadian citizen, returned to his native country to interview Mir-Hossein Moussavi, the prime challenger to incumbent President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad. When Moussavi's supporters protested Ahmadinejad's declaration of victory, Bahari smuggled footage of the riots to the BBC. He was soon arrested by the Revolutionary Guard and -- led by a man known only as "Rosewater" -- was interrogated and tortured for 118 days.

programme.desc: When all-American Ramone discovers he is the heir to the European kingdom of San Pablo, he is daunted by the prospect of becoming king. To prepare him for his royal duties, King Felipe hires royal expert Angelica to show Ramone the ropes.

programme.title: Good Witch: Curse From a Rose

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.desc: Hallmark Original Series. Sam's ex-wife Linda threatens to come between them.

programme.title: Good Witch

programme.title: Little John
programme.desc: Hallmark Hall of Fame. A father reunites his daughter and the child she gave up for adoption.

programme.title: The Beach House
programme.desc: Hallmark Hall of Fame. Cara returns to the scenic Lowcountry to visit her mother.

programme.title: The Proposition
programme.desc: In the 1880s Australia, a lawman offers renegade Charlie Burns a difficult choice. In order to save his younger brother from the gallows, Charlie must hunt down and kill his older brother, who is wanted for rape and murder. Venturing into one of the Outback's most inhospitable regions, Charlie faces a terrible moral dilemma that can end only in violence.

programme.title: A Little Bit of Heaven
programme.desc: New Orleans ad executive Marley Corbett (Kate Hudson) is a free-spirited woman who embraces her easy sexuality, shuns commitment, and gains support and strength from a close circle of friends. Then Marley learns she has terminal colon cancer. Despite her determination not to be tied down in a serious relationship, Marley finds herself falling in love with her handsome doctor (Gael Garca Bernal), even as her health slowly deteriorates.

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Following a traumatic experience, former Special Forces member Dean Cage (Wesley Snipes) is trying to pick up the pieces of his fractured life. With the help of detective Amy Knight (Jacqueline Obradors), Dean tries to block out the painful wartime memories, including the death of his best friend. Everything goes awry, however, when Dean is mistaken for a rogue CIA agent. He is abducted and given a truth serum, and now he must find an antidote to the debilitating psychotropic drug.

programme.title: A Birder's Guide to Everything
programme.desc: On the eve of his father's remarriage, a teenage birding enthusiast (Kodi Smit-McPhee) leads his friends on a road trip to find an extremely rare duck.

programme.title: The Illusionist
programme.desc: A master magician named Eisenheim vies with Crown Prince Leopold of Vienna for the hand of noblewoman Sophie, the girl he once loved. He brings his considerable powers to bear on the prince, as she is about to be named royal fiance. However, a police inspector named Uhl tries to warn Eisenheim that he is playing a very dangerous game.

programme.title: Trespass
programme.desc: Fast-talking diamond dealer Kyle Miller (Nicolas Cage) and his wife, Sarah (Nicole Kidman), live the good life in a beautiful home surrounded by thick woods. Their dream life turns into a nightmare when violent thieves, led by Elias (Ben Mendelsohn), invade their home disguised as police officers. With Kyle and Sarah now frightened captives, Kyle knows he must use every negotiating trick in his book, for once Elias and his men get what they want, the Millers will likely be killed.

programme.title: Transsiberian
programme.desc: On their way home from China, married Christian missionaries Roy (Woody Harrelson) and Jessie (Emily Mortimer) take a train from Beijing to Moscow. On board, they befriend Carlos (Eduardo Noriega) and Abby (Kate Mara). When Roy does not return in time at one stop, Jessie waits for him to catch up at the next station. Carlos and Abby stay with her, insisting the town is unsafe, however Carlos' attempts to "befriend" Jessie radically change the dynamic of the trip.

programme.title: Custody

programme.desc: Double-crosses and plot twists abound when a corrupt real-estate developer (Tim Robbins) decides not to pay a ransom to his wife's (Jennifer Aniston) kidnappers (John Hawkes, Yasiin Bey).

programme.title: The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent
programme.desc: Unfulfilled and facing financial ruin, actor Nick Cage accepts a $1 million offer to attend a wealthy fan's birthday party. Things take a wildly unexpected turn when a CIA operative recruits Cage for an unusual mission. Taking on the role of a lifetime, he soon finds himself channeling his most iconic and beloved characters to save himself and his loved ones.

programme.title: Rambo
programme.desc: Having long-since abandoned his life as a lethal soldier, John Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) lives a solitary life near the Thai border. Two weeks after guiding a missionary (Julie Benz) and her comrades into Burma, he gets an urgent call for help. The missionaries have not returned and although he is reluctant to embrace violence again, Rambo sets out to rescue the captives from the Burmese army.

programme.title: Rambo: Last Blood
programme.desc: Vietnam War veteran John Rambo tries to find some semblance of peace by raising horses on a ranch in Arizona. He's also developed a special familial bond with a woman named Maria and her teenage granddaughter Gabriela. But when a vicious Mexican cartel kidnaps Gabriela, Rambo crosses the border on a bloody and personal quest to rescue her and punish those responsible.

programme.title: Secret Headquarters
programme.desc: Young Charlie Kincaid, who discovers a secret headquarters under his home that seems to belong to a superhero. He shares it with his friends, and they start to believe that his estranged father might have a secret double life.

programme.title: The Phantom
programme.desc: The story begins as an expedition lands on the island of Bengalla, seeking the skulls of Touganda. Believed to harness an energy force of power, they could spell disaster for mankind.

programme.title: Alex Rider: Operation Stormbreaker
programme.desc: After his uncle dies, a young boy learns of his relative's true occupation as an undercover spy and is later recruited to be undercover himself. Based on the novel by Anthony Horowitz.

programme.title: The Boxtrolls
programme.desc: When evil Archibald Snatcher decides to capture the Boxtrolls lovable, box-wearing creatures it's up to Eggs and his friend Winnie to same them.

programme.title: The Mechanic
programme.desc: One of an elite group of assassins, Arthur Bishop (Jason Statham) may be the best in the business. Bishop carries out his assignments with precision, detachment and adherence to a strict code, but when Harry (Donald Sutherland), his close friend and mentor, is murdered, Bishop vows revenge. Harry's son (Ben Foster) comes to him with vengeance in his heart and a desire to learn Bishop's trade, signaling the birth of a deadly partnership.

programme.title: Walking Tall
programme.desc: Tennessee Sheriff Buford Pusser (Joe Don Baker) carries a big stick after thugs beat him up and kill his wife (Elizabeth Hartman).

programme.title: Four Brothers
programme.desc: When an inner-city Detroit foster mother (Fionnula Flanagan) is murdered in a botched holdup, four of her now-grown adopted children suspect it was no random killing. Rising musician Jack (Garrett Hedlund), former-Marine Angel (Tyrese Gibson), hotheaded hockey player Bobby (Mark Wahlberg) and settled-down husband and father Jeremiah (Andr Benjamin) go on the hunt for neighborhood criminal kingpin Victor Sweet (Chiwetel Ejiofor) while being trailed themselves by the local beat cops.

programme.title: Lake Placid 2
programme.desc: Three giant crocodiles terrorize locals and tourists at a lakeside resort.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home at the end of the war to find their family has been kidnapped by Confederate forces.

programme.title: A Fire In The Sky
programme.desc: The President plans to divert a comet heading towads earth with a nuclear missile.

programme.title: The Collector
programme.desc: Clerk Freddie Clegg (Terence Stamp), an avid butterfly collector, wins a football pool and buys a country house with a large basement. He then kidnaps art student Miranda Grey (Samantha Eggar), a longtime crush of his, after trailing her in a van. Freddie locks Miranda in the basement, and buys her clothes and books, so that she can get to know him. They initially agree that she will stay at the house for a month, but Miranda fears what will happen when the time comes for her to leave.

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction
programme.desc: Reserved college dean Susan Middlecott (Rosalind Russell) is all business and can't be bothered with love. However, when Susan meets charming British astronomy professor Alec Stevenson (Ray Milland), it seems that romance could be in the air. Though she resists being paired with Alec, things don't go as planned -- particularly when a publicity agent and even Susan's amiable father (Edmund Gwenn) get involved. Soon Susan may just be in love, whether she likes it or not.

programme.title: Salome
programme.desc: Princess Salome (Rita Hayworth) is the daughter of King Herod (Charles Laughton) of Galilee. Cast out after her affair with Caesar's nephew, Salome finds herself back in the kingdom of her father when she falls in love with Claudius (Stewart Granger), the commander of her father's army. Meanwhile, Salome's evil mother, Queen Herodias, is continually being condemned by John the Baptist, and plotting to use Salome as a tool to get the prophet executed.

programme.title: The Guilt of Janet Ames
programme.desc: War widow Janet Ames (Rosalind Russell) is struck by a car, and later her doctors suspect she may have been attempting suicide. A note in her pocket lists five men whom her husband died saving in battle, and they are contacted to help Janet's recovery. The first man on the list, jaded reporter Smitty Cobb (Melvyn Douglas), is offended when Janet says she hopes to prove her husband died in vain to save five worthless men, and offers to "introduce" Janet to each of the men through hypnotism.

programme.title: Stardust
programme.desc: In hopes of wooing a girl, Tristan promises to bring her a falling star. He soon discovers the star is actually a celestial beauty named Yvaine. When an old witch Lamia attempts to steal Yvaine?s youth, Tristan must protect her.

programme.title: Ghost Town

programme.title: Florence Foster Jenkins

programme.title: Session 9

But Danvers State Mental Hospital, closed down for 15 years, is about to receive five new visitors...

programme.title: Tremors

But just as the two try to skip town, they happen upon a series of mysterious deaths and a concerned seismologist (Finn Carter) studying unnatural readings below the ground. With the help of an eccentric couple (Reba McEntire, Michael Gross), the group fights for survival against giant, worm-like monsters hungry for human flesh.

programme.title: The Signal

programme.title: The New Daughter

Kurt Steiner leading the mission, aided by Liam Devlin, an Irishman with a deep hatred of England. As the plan unfolds, it seems to be going well -- until certain events threaten the group's shot at success.

programme.title: A Very Sordid Wedding

programme.title: Babysplitters
programme.desc: Two couples who are ambivalent about having children decide to share one baby. It seems like the perfect compromise until things spiral out of control.

The scene, however, is really the ending of Ethan's novel, which his agent (Carol Kane) calls "unrealistic." Ethan soon meets a waitress, Jesse (Alyssa Milano), and falls in love with her despite her growing devotion to Troy (Michael Landes), a charming businessman. Ye-na is an idol trainee and Gi-beom is a teacher who looked after Yoo-ri. As the investigation dives into the lives of these people, it spirals out of control due to conflicting statements between the three, but detectives find out that actions of Hye-young started causing cracks in Yoo-ri's heart. Deeply believing that she was doing everything possible for her child out of love, can Hye-young uncover the real truth behind her daughter's death?Yoo-ri, a seemingly model student from a well-to do family suddenly commits suicide at a lakeside campsite with several people she met via a suicide group.

programme.title: Oh! Brothers
programme.desc: After the death of his father who had left the house and his family, his debt was inherited by Sang-woo who is unable to cope with the debt. So he finds another heir, a half-brother and his mother, to fend off the debt of his father.

The letter is written by Jung-suok, his first love from 23 years ago, the love tucked away into a corner of his heart. As he reads the handwritten letter, old memories from all those years ago come to life.The voice of his first love from 23 years ago

A young cop makes efforts to connect with the people in the community as one of the good guys. programme.desc: A vengeful judge who believes Lucas was responsible for his son's death, kidnaps Mark McCain to revenge himself on Lucas.

programme.desc: When Mark tries to play Cupid between Lucas and a stranger who arrives in North Fork, the girl's older brothers accuse him of trifling with her affections and challenge him to fight.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.desc: Young Dan Willard takes on Marshal Micah Torrence's job. With no experience, he takes a tough stand with a bunch of Texas cowhands whose high spirits are evident at the saloon.

programme.desc: Lucas and Mark are returning from a big cattle sale when the stage is robbed by three outlaws. Lucas, desperate to recover the money that was stolen, is determined to pursue the outlaws.

programme.desc: Rebel is hurt by a porcupine and Ricky gets help for him from a new southern doctor who just arrived in town.

programme.desc: A prospector and spinner of tall tales helps Ricky capture a gang of rustlers.

While hiding at a tavern, Jeongi overhears a conversation between King Seonjo and Euldam, only to be startled when her eyes meet Gwanghae's. King Seonjo orders Euldam to create ritual vessels to be used for the Jongmyo ancestral rites.

programme.title: Goddess of Fire Ep.3
programme.desc: Tormented by the shattered fragments of the sacred jar of King Taejo, Gwanghae seeks out Son Haengsu. Recognizing him, Hwa-ryeong urges Gwanghae to meet Jeongi, and he is stunned to learn that she is Euldam's daughter. When Jeongi falls from her horse and lands in Gwanghae's arms, she panics and struggles in surpriseonly for them both to tumble to the ground.

programme.title: Goddess of Fire Ep.4
programme.desc: Determined to prove that the sacred jar of King Taejo was deliberately broken, Gangcheon drops the vessel onto the floor. As King Seonjo erupts in fury, Gwanghae steps forward and claims full responsibility for the act. King Seonjo immediately orders Euldam's arrest. In a desperate attempt to save her father, Jeongi strikes the petition drum, proclaiming Euldam's innocence to the court

programme.title: Goddess of Fire Ep.5
programme.desc: Jeongi clings to Euldam, sobbing and begging him not to go, while the wounded Taedo fumes in frustration after seeing an assassin vanish into the darkness. Seeking out Hwa-ryeong, Jeongi travels to the merchant guild, where she comes face to face with Gangcheon. She boldly asks whether he will apologize for humiliating Euldam once she becomes the greatest master potter in Joseon.

programme.title: Fight For My Way Ep.12
programme.desc: Knowing that Juman did not come home the night before, Seolhui heads to Yejin's place with Aera. Juman explains how he had no choice and that nothing happened between him and Yejin, but Seolhui breaks up with him anyway. Meanwhile, Dongman falls into a dilemma when Taksu publicly requests for a special rematch.

programme.title: Fight For My Way Ep.13
programme.desc: Juman tells the truth to his mother and Seolhui's mother about his breakup with Seolhui. Meanwhile, Aera gets accepted to do the final interview for both the KBC announcer position and the MMA cage announcer position. However, she falls into a dilemma because the interviews are on the same day.

programme.title: Fight For My Way Ep.14

programme.title: Fight For My Way Ep.15
programme.desc: Ever since the breakup, Juman has become more desperate for Seolhui. Unable to get over her, he begs Seolhui for forgiveness and a chance to redeem himself. Meanwhile, Dongman suffers a severe injury from the fight and Aera warns him never to fight again.

programme.title: Fight For My Way Ep.16

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Sky Island Solitaire: Backpack Hunting Coues Deer in Arizona
programme.desc: Steve returns to southern Arizona to stalk the elusive Coues deer. Unaccompanied, Steve immerses himself in the quiet southwest desert and gets intimate with one of the most wary animals in the west. Throughout the hunt, Steve articulates why solo time in trophy country is good for the soul.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Ribeye of the Sky: Sandhill Cranes in West Texas
programme.desc: Steve and bird hunting aficionado Ronny Boehme join up with wildlife biologist Ed Arnett in Lubbock, Texas.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: The Coldest Hunt: Nunivak Island Muskox
programme.desc: Lightning strikes twice: Steven Rinella has somehow beaten the odds and drawn a second Muskox tag after having to forfeit his first one four years ago due to unforeseen circumstances. Steve has always regretted passing up an opportunity to hunt Muskox but with another tag in his pocket, nothing will stop this adventure. We learn about the native history and culture of Nunivak Island's as Steve tries to stay warm while chasing Muskox 30 miles offshore in the Bering Sea.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: The last time Joe Rogan and Bryan Callen went out with Steven Rinella they were soaked head to toe and came home meatless. To remedy their meat crisis while keeping them dry, Steve sets up a springtime wild turkey hunt in sunny California. Steve gives Joe and Bryan the A to Z on hunting, butchering, and cooking the wild turkey. Steve caps off the introductory lesson by preparing his favorite turkey recipe: Schnitzel.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In the first part of this series, Steve attempts a unique spring hunt for sooty grouse in the coastal rainforests of southeast Alaska. These mysterious hooters make for a hunt that is markedly different from any other and success doesn't come easily. They say blind squirrels can find a nut, but will Steve harvest a grouse?

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In Part One, Steve experienced the difficulty of hunting the Sooty grouse of southeast Alaska.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Wild to Table: Memorable Meals Cooking Special
programme.desc: Steve loves to fish as much as he loves to hunt.Steve is on a river in SW Montana for a day to catch.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Up at the Cabin: Prince of Wales Island Black Bear
programme.desc: Last spring, Steve decided to pass up an opportunity to kill a black bear in favor of an extended up close and personal experience. This time, Steve heads back to his shack on Prince of Wales Island and he's brought his friend Paul Neess from Vortex Optics along to share the experience of using a canoe to slip in close to these giant black bears.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: All across America hunters kick off the fall hunting season with a weekend of doves, friends, and food. Steve's lifelong friend, Ronny Boehme has invited Steve out to his digs in Virginia for the dove opener. To prep for opening day, Steve and Ron spend a day brushing up on their shooting skills on a sporting clays course followed by a pigeon hunt. Steve shares simple, delicious cooking methods for doves and pigeons.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Ryan Callaghan and Aaron Evans join Steve on an epic adventure in British Columbia's Rockies to pursue grizzly bears. Steve has long desired to take a grizzly but only if he can do it in a way that fits his personal ethics. The hunt is dampened by frustrating weather but Steve finds a way to fix a tasty meal.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Lobster of the Prairie: Wyoming Antelope
programme.desc: Steve is fed up with disrespect for one of the world's most unique game animals-the pronghorn antelope.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Land of the Giants: Idaho Mule Deer Part 1
programme.desc: Steve's quest for a giant mule deer buck continues in central Idaho.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.sub-title: Land of the Giants: Idaho Mule Deer Part 2
programme.desc: Steve's quest for a giant mule deer buck continues in central Idaho. To help Steve in his journey, Ryan Callaghan has offered up one of his best spots as well as his keen spotting skills. The duo backpack hunt in some of the West's steepest and prettiest mountains seeking the colossal buck of Steve's dreams. In part two Steve finds the buck he's been searching for his whole life. The dream is realized and Steve and Ryan feast on a slow cooked roast.

programme.title: Our Wild Life
programme.desc: Chad and Kelli Varnado love the outdoor life, especially for their son Jack. Together, the family trap shoot in the backyard in preparation for the duck opener, as well as bring home a couple of squirrels harvested from their trees to cook into gravy and fry up for dinner.

programme.title: Dead Meat
programme.desc: Scott Leysath is targeting saltwater and freshwater fish in this action-packed episode of Dead Meat! Joined by a few familiar faces, Leysath is fishing for California Halibut off the coast of Santa Cruz with his pal, Kevin Phillips. From Santa Cruz to Reno, Scott meets up with River Klass, host of the Rach America TV show, for a little range time at Reno Guns & Range. And finally, the two join JD Richey, a 2024 California Outdoor Hall of Fame fishing guide, on Pyramid Lake for some Lahontan Cutthroat Trout action. Oh, and there's machine guns. Lots of machine guns!

programme.title: Feral
programme.desc: If you asked experts what the most prevalent predator species in the United States is, without hesitation, the answer would be the Burmese pythons in the Florida Everglades. Growing up to 26-feet long and weighing as much as 200 pounds, the Burmese python has completely altered the ecosystem of the Everglades by eliminating over 99% of the native mammal population. To save the 'Glades, the hunter has become the hunted as Dusty ""Wildman"" Crum has made it his mission to eradicate this species. Luckily for Yia, python is considered a delicacy in many countries, and Dusty believes these constrictors should be restricted to life on a plate, which helps take a bite out of the problem.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The most important fish catch is the one that got you hooked on fishing in the first place, and for many of us that catch happened early in life. On this episode Ali and Rush grab their favorite little fishing buddies for a great day on the water on their respective coasts. In Florida, Rush spends time with his son Kade fishing for huge permit while Ali takes his nephew Duke out for some wholesome yellowtail action in California.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.sub-title: Hard Truths of Conservation - "The hunting heritage of South Africa
programme.desc: South Africa offers an incredible insight into the hunter and gatherer history of ancestors. Dan Cabela re-traces the footsteps of humanity's forefathers and explores how modern, private ownership of land has helped re-balance the human relationship with nature.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.sub-title: Hard Truths of Conservation - "Tajikistan, a Mountainous Land
programme.desc: With the fall of the Soviet Union, wildlife populations in Tajikistan were devastated, bringing some of their unique mountain species to the brink of extinction. With the help of funds generated through hunting, vast areas are now being conserved and protected. Dan Cabela explores this conservation success.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.sub-title: Hard Truths of Conservation - "Anti-poaching in Tanzania
programme.desc: Human encroachment and pressure from poaching are the greatest threats to wildlife in Africa. Dan Cabela has traveled to Tanzania to see how Robin Hurt safaris manages two large conservation areas in the face of these daily challenges.

programme.title: Danny Johnson
programme.desc: Danny Johnson's hilarious, clean stand-up has entertained audiences in comedy clubs, corporate events, and churches nationwide. Often called a cross between Jerry Seinfeld and Kevin James Danny's show is relatable, engaging, and always hilarious. Danny has starred in numerous TV commercials, Comedy Central's Laugh Riots, Florida's Funniest Comedian semi-finalist, Winner-Carnival Cruise line Comedy Challenge, Finalist in Search for the One Christian Comedy contest, and has had the pleasure of sharing the stage with Chris Rock, Bob Saget, Billy Gardell, Richard Lewis, and a variety of others. Danny has led a dual track career for over a decade achieving success in both corporate America and as a comedian. Blending his unique skill sets led to him publishing his first book, "You Stink and They Know It! A practical guide to nailing your next job interview."

programme.title: Caleb Elliott: Diary of a Smooth Black Kid
programme.desc: One of DryBar's youngest comics, Caleb Elliot proves that age is anything but a setback.

programme.title: Bob Zany
programme.sub-title: I Think I Handled That Well
programme.desc: He simply reaches into a bottomless grab bag of jokes, so smooth and effortless that it would be easy to overlook just how much talent and skill is behind the process'"

programme.title: Andy Gold
programme.desc: Andy Gold has appeared in festivals and competitions all over the country, including the Boston Comedy Festival, San Diego Comedy Festival, Laugh Your Asheville Off and Comcast's Trial by Laughter Comedy Festival. Andy's comedy has also been featured on Hulu and Kevin Hart's Laugh out Loud network on Sirius XM.

programme.title: Jamie Lissow
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Jamie Lissow is best known for his role in the current Netflix Original Series Real Rob, alongside SNL alum Rob Schneider, a show Jamie co-wrote and co-produced. Jamie made his network television debut on The Tonight Show and has since appeared on The Late Late Show, Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central's Premium Blend, Gotham Live, Star Search, and his own half-hour Comedy Central special. A headliner at comedy clubs across the country, he's also been featured at The Montreal Comedy Festival and The Great American Comedy Festival. Lissow has appeared on Fox News Redeye more than 50 times while still managing to have no political opinions.

programme.title: Helene Angley: Queen Size
programme.desc: Helene brings honesty to the stage that helps everyone relax-- and laugh at the joys and pains of aging, being a married mother of two and all that the generation gap brings!

programme.title: Greg Warren
programme.desc: Greg Warren is a nationally touring headliner and has been featured on Late Night with Seth Meyers, Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central Presents, The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson, BET and CMT. Greg is a fan favorite on the nationally syndicated Bob and Tom Radio Show and can be heard daily on Sirius/XM.

programme.title: Kjell Bjorgen
programme.sub-title: I'm Sorry But I Won't Apologize
programme.desc: Kjellbegan his comedy career in Los Angeles, California. He gained some notoriety when featured in both the Chicago comedy festival and Montreal comedy festival. He decided to hone his craft and perform on the road. His hard work paid off when asked to be the opener on the Lewis Black Nothing'sSacredtour. You may have seen him on NBC's LateFridayand Comedy Central's Live at Gotham.

programme.title: Password
programme.desc: Two contestants, each teamed with a celebrity partner, compete in a word-association game. One player tries to guess a word based on clues offered by his or her partner. The game is timed, and if the clue-giver inadvertently says part of the word, a buzzer sounds and that round is lost. When the time is up, the team with the most points wins, and the non-celebrity contestants wins cash.

programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: Gene Rayburn hosts this comedy-game show hybrid in which contestants try to match answers given by celebrities to humorous, and often risque, fill-in-the-blank questions. The contestant with the most points at the end of the game advances to play the bonus round, in which the contestant has a chance to win thousands of dollars, with the actual amount dependent on the rules in place at the time of the episode.

programme.title: Card Sharks
programme.desc: This show from legendary Mark Goodson-Bill Todman Productions features two contestants trying to predict answers to survey questions for the opportunity to play a game with oversized playing cards for a chance to win cash. One contestant guesses how many people (out of 100) gave a certain answer to a question and the other contestant then guesses if the number is higher or lower than the opponent's guess. The winning contestant then faces a row of cards and must determine if each succeeding card is higher or lower than the one that precedes it. The contestant who wins two out of three games wins the match and plays the bonus round, called Money Cards. The Money Cards round is similar to the card game in the main game but with three levels of cards instead of one row. The contestant is given $200 at the beginning of Money Cards and wagers any or all of that money when guessing if the cards will be higher or lower than the previous one. A perfect round could earn the contestant $28,800.

programme.title: Steve
programme.desc: For five seasons, Steve Harvey hosted a daytime talk show that was based in Chicago. In 2017, looking to focus more on celebrity guests, the show got a face-lift -- including shortening the title to simply "Steve" -- along with a move to Los Angeles, where there is no shortage of famous people for Harvey to welcome to his stage as guests. In addition to conducting interviews, Harvey brings his fresh -- and often funny -- perspective to the day's hot topics and Hollywood happenings. The show also features games and comedy and lifestyle segments. Whether he's chatting with a star or sharing his opinions on the news, Harvey does it as only he can.

programme.desc: After Nick (Horatio Sanz) makes an insensitive remark, his travel agent decides to get some payback by sending him and his best friend, Jerry (Cuba Gooding Jr.), on a cruise for gay men. As the true nature of their situation gradually dawns on them, they start to get over their feelings of homophobia and meet potential mates. For Nick, love takes the form of a gorgeous model, Inga (Victoria Silvstedt), while Jerry develops feelings for dance instructor Gabriella (Roselyn Snchez).

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: Feisty Morgan Adams (Geena Davis) inherits her late buccaneer father's galleon and one-third of a map to buried treasure located on Cutthroat Island. The map had been tattooed on her father's scalp, and to find the treasure, she must locate and scalp his two brothers. But Morgan's swashbuckling uncle, Dawg Brown (Frank Langella), wants the treasure for himself, and does battle with his headstrong niece and her unwilling accomplice, Latin-speaking physician William Shaw (Matthew Modine).

programme.title: Foxy Brown
programme.desc: Unable to pay back the $20,000 he owes the mob, small-time hustler Link (Antonio Fargas) instead gives up the identity of an undercover cop (Terry Carter) who happens to be dating his sister, Foxy Brown (Pam Grier). When gangsters later kill the cop, Foxy is quick to make the connection and swears vengeance. Posing as a prostitute, and with the help of a group of neighborhood vigilantes, she gradually tracks down the hit men, their Mafia bosses and her own brother.

programme.title: Dr. Chris Pet Vet
programme.desc: Chris is called out of the city to help a local celebrity: a bull whose horns are growing into its skull. And Chris swings by a turtle rescue group to help with a local sea turtle epidemic. Then, while the doc's away, Neil gets to play.

programme.title: Dr. Chris Pet Vet

programme.title: Beaded Lizard vs. Gila Monster!
programme.desc: Beaded lizard vs. Gila monster. Coyote compares these venomous reptiles in a desert showdown, highlighting their bite strength and venom use.One of the world's most dangerous stings comes from the killer bee. Coyote gets stung and breaks down their behavior and threat level.

programme.title: Cactus Maze Runner!
programme.desc: Mark enters a twisting maze filled with cactus spines. One wrong move means pain, so he's got to think fastand duck low.This spider might bitebut will it? Coyote examines the risk and anatomy of a feared species in this myth-busting episode.

programme.title: Did I Catch the Deadliest Snake in America?
programme.desc: Coyote may have caught the deadliest snake in the U.S. He examines its venom, behavior, and what makes it so feared among experts.Handling a black widow spider sounds insane, but Coyote does it to test bite behavior and safety protocols. Proceed with caution!

programme.title: Sucked by Tiger Leeches!
programme.desc: Leeches attack in this jungle trek! Mark shows how tiger leeches feed and what it takes to remove them once they latch on.In the aftermath of wildfires, koalas need help. Coyote joins a rescue team in Australia to treat, care for, and rehome injured marsupials.

programme.title: Stung by a Stonefish! (Rare Freshwater Version)
programme.desc: A rare freshwater stonefish delivers one of the most painful stings Mark has ever endured. It's both risky and riveting.The thorny devil lizard is covered in spikes and full of surprises. Mark explores its desert defenses and water-collecting superpowers.

programme.title: Baby Komodo Encounter Are They Dangerous?!
programme.desc: Baby Komodo dragons may be small, but they pack serious attitude. Coyote gets up close to answer the question: are they dangerous?A wobbegong shark hiding in a tide pool? Mark finds this camouflaged predator and explains its hunting style and unique appearance.

programme.title: Don't Try This with a Devil!
programme.desc: Nicknamed the devil, this creature is covered in barbs and bad attitude. Coyote investigates what makes it so infamous.The bulldog ant is aggressive, fast, and loaded with venom. Mark takes on its painful sting and breaks down what makes this ant so deadly.

programme.title: Deadly Bite!? Blue Ring Octopus
programme.desc: Bright, beautiful, and deadlythe blue ring octopus carries venom strong enough to kill. Mark gets close to show what to look out for.A simple photo turns into a full-on wilderness blooper reel. Mark's attempt at the perfect selfie gets out of handliterally.

programme.title: Pink Creature from Down Under! (Rare Turtle Frog)
programme.desc: With its pink skin and frog-like squeal, the turtle frog is one of the weirdest animals from Down Under. Mark finds and features this rarity.Coyote attempts one of his boldest moves: catching a crocodile barehanded. A high-stakes capture requiring skill, speed, and nerve.

programme.title: Giant Crocodile Found Could You Outswim Him?
programme.desc: A massive crocodile emergescan a human really outrun it? Coyote pits human reflexes against one of nature's top aquatic predators.A venomous brown snake hiding in a toilet? Coyote investigates this bizarre real-life scenario and what it means for homeowners in snake territory.

programme.title: Human Hand vs. Box of Pain!
programme.desc: A mystery box, a painful surprise. Coyote risks his hand in a blind challenge to test different insect stings and bites by touch alone.This armored lizard looks like a living dinosaur. Mark handles its powerful bite and explores the evolution of its protective scales.

programme.title: Stung by the Devil's Toilet Paper!

programme.title: Attacked by Bloodsucking Parasites!

programme.title: Baby Einstein

programme.desc: Discover sign language! Enjoy upbeat, classical melodies as you learn how to sign words and activities related to common main street businesses, where your food comes from, activities related to dining out and more. Learn through real-life footage, narration, and repetition.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: With the Dolittle, and other Baby programs under their belts, the tots who follow Julie Aigner-Clark's Baby Einstein series will sidle up to Baby Newton expecting a similar exploration of building blocks to brilliance, but this time there's a wrinkle or two. Animation makes its first appearance, and parents steeped in keep-it-simple culture may object to the springy "I Know My Shapes" song, a departure from classical-only video predecessors.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Hop aboard to see vehicles that travel by land, water and sky! See real-life images of cars, boats and planes in this on-the-go adventure that features cameos from some of your favorite Baby Einstein characters, all while listening to music from around the world.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.sub-title: Lullaby Time: Soothing Sounds for Baby
programme.desc: One of the greatest joys you'll ever experience is bonding with your baby during those calm, quiet moments. Lullaby Time: Soothing Sounds for Baby provides comforting sights and sounds as you relax and share this precious downtime.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.sub-title: Baby's Favorite Places: First Words Around Town
programme.desc: As babies turn one year old, they continue to develop their communication skills. Meanwhile, with you as their guide, they also begin to explore the world beyond their front door. Baby's Favorite Places presents them with a playful introduction to 20 words for the names of familiar locations from the market, to the library, to the local park.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: As little ones grow, their innate sense of wonder grows too, creating an occasion for celebration with each new discovery. Baby Galileo Discovering the Sky introduces them to that remarkable canopy above us: the sun and moon, fluffy clouds, shimmering stars, colorful planets and whirling galaxies.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Meet fascinating creatures from across the globe and learn to run, hop, and crawl like your favorite animal friends. Dance and sing along to discover animal names and the native habitats of the world's most unique creatures. See real-life images of lions and zebras on the African savannah, then learn animal names through repetition and narration, or simply watch your favorite animals play!

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Every stage is an exciting adventure with your newborn. As babies grow, they absorb a wide variety of sights and sounds. And with so much to see and hear, infants seem to enjoy, and be most soothed by, gentle sounds such as your voice or pleasant, restful music. Treat your child -- and yourself -- to the delights of Baby Bach Musical Adventure, an award-winning program that exposes babies to the joy and majesty of classical music while presenting them with stimulating, colorful images.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.sub-title: Baby Einstein: Let's Learn about Dogs, Cats and More
programme.desc: Meet Cats, Dogs, Birds, Bugs and Woodland Creatures! Learn simple words through narration and repetition. Meet all sorts of creatures from domestic kittens to jungle cats, puppies, big and small birds, butterflies, lady bugs, otters and deer!! See whimsical toys and puppets.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.sub-title: Baby Einstein: Let's Learn Signs: Family and Home
programme.desc: Discover sign language along with your favorite Baby Einstein Characters! Learn how to sign the names of common things from different objects found at home and outside, family, and even your very own neighborhood through repetition and narration. Real-life images of toys and objects along with gentle melodies engage viewers as they learn a variety of different signs.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.sub-title: Baby Einstein: Let's Learn About Animals Around the World
programme.desc: Meet fascinating animals from across the globe! Dance and sing along with puppets and discover some of the world's most unique creatures. programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Cal, Neptune, Opus, Dean, Tinker and others learn about the flora and fauna of the ocean through STEAM-based principles and real-life footage.

programme.desc: The girls are driven to distraction by their frisky puppies frolicking all over Berry Bitty City! Full of energy and thinking that everything in town is a toy for them to play with, they cause comical mayhem wherever they go. Strawberry suggests the pups need a place of their own where they can play, a dog park! The girls decide to call in Huckleberry, who runs an animal hotel in Berry Big City, to help design the park.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: While sipping cider in Strawberry's caf, the girls muse about how they cannot wait for winter to arrive. They list the various traditions they love about the season but the one they all agree on is the Glimmerberry Ball. Strawberry mentions that she doesn't think the caf can hold the party this year because of how the town has grown. The girls decide to split up and search for a new location.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Lemon is ecstatic. She races out of her salon and goes around to the other girls' houses proclaiming that she "did it!" and beckoning them to join her. They follow her back and are completely dazzled by her newest creation - Glamicures. They are brightly colored, jeweled manicures with tiny microchips inside that play songs when the wearer moves her hand. Each girl lines up to receive her new glamicure and soon there is a cacophony of color and sound.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: While working in her store, Orange overhears the Berrykins laughing and shouting outside. When she goes to the door to investigate, a clump of dandelion fluff gets blown inside chased by three Berrykins. She watches as they head butt the clump around until it floats back toward Orange. Just as it floats close, she gives it a bat sending it outside and the Berrykins happily chasing after it. Wanting in on the fun, she joins them.

programme.title: On the Road
programme.desc: Strawberry, Cherry and the girls form a new band, Strawberry and the Sweet Beats, and prepare to go on the road to perform at the Opening Ceremony of the Berry Big City Games! While master mechanic Berrykin Bruce turns Cherry's tour bus into the band's hotel-on-wheels, Strawberry and her friends pack for the big trip. But the rest of Berry Bitty City points out that someone needs to run the girls' businesses while they are gone. Strawberry and her friends give the Berrykins a crash course in city-sitting.

programme.title: A Boy and His Dogs
programme.desc: Berrykins Ed and Earl report to Princess Berrykin and Strawberry that they are certain there is a monster in the berry patch! They saw something with many noses and many tails making weird noises in the bushes. But upon further investigation by Strawberry and her friends, it is discovered that friendly boy Huckleberry Pie was driving his pet-mobile of orphan dogs through the countryside, took a wrong turn and got stuck near Berry Bitty City. What the Berrykins mistook for a monster was really the bunch of cute pups Huck has been trying to get adopted. While Huck's van is being repaired, Strawberry invites Huck and his seven pups to spend the night in the new bedroom above the marketplace, while she bunks in her old bedroom above the caf. The next morning, Strawberry discovers that the playful pups have given her bedroom a total makeover the wrong kind. An embarrassed Huck insists on staying until he can repair the damage.

programme.title: Sid's Holiday Adventure!
programme.desc: But this year, Sid and his family are visiting relatives where it's chilly and cold. Sid wonders why it can't be warm everywhere? At school, Sid discovers that temperatures are different all over the world!

programme.title: The Wind Did It!
programme.desc: At school, Sid and his friends discover that wind is strong enough to make sand dunes, waves, move sail boats, and even blow away a pile of leaves!

programme.title: Sky's the Limit
programme.desc: When a storm causes a giant boulder to cut off Berry Bitty City's water supply, Strawberry and the girls face the possibility of having to move away from their homes. With the help of Mr. Longface Caterpillar, the girls set out on an adventure to save their town.

She finds herself missing the company of her fellow Persimmon fan Huckleberry, and thinks up a great way to get him to visit. She invites Huck to co-write a story with her to submit to an online mystery magazine.. Huck eagerly accepts and comes for a visit. He is especially hopeful that if the story is accepted, he can raise some funds for his new Huckleberry's Hotel for Homeless Pets.

programme.title: The Mystery of the Disappearing Dog Show
programme.desc: When Huckleberry and Blueberry's Patti Persimmon-style mystery story is rejected by an online mystery magazine, Blueberry and Huck have to come up with a new way to raise support for Huckleberry's Hotel for Homeless Pets back in Berry Big City. Strawberry suggests they hold a big dog show! Plum makes over-ambitious plans to display talents that her dog does not quite have, trying to teach him complicated dance routines. When everyone learns what awesome feats Plum has planned for her own dog, the competition heats up, everyone wanting their pup to perform in an even more spectacular manner. The training sessions go comically awry, with morale starting to plummet.

programme.title: Helper Car
programme.desc: Cartoon for kids about helper cars: a fire truck, an ambulance, a police car and a tow truck. Why these cars and trucks are useful? Because they help people and other cars: fire truck can put out fire, ambulance helps people, when they are hurt or sick, it could drive them to the hospital. Police car patrols the city. Tow truck help other cars, when they are broken down. Watch new car cartoon and learn about helper cars!

programme.desc: Hey Guys! I am Amy Lee! Welcome to my Channel! Check it out for videos on Minecraft, Roblox, The Sims plus other great games!

programme.title: IncrediTales
programme.desc: IncrediTales - Tricky Wolf: Alice is eating a yummy ice cream in the park but Wolf is up to his old tricks.

programme.title: Ebb and Flo
programme.desc: The world of Ebb and Flo is seen through Ebb's eyes and Ebb reveals all the emotions grown-ups try to hide. Flo doesn't think of Ebb as a dog, and Ebb doesn't think of Flo as a small human, they just are the best of friends. Until Bird arrives to lovingly disrupt Ebb's world. Ebb and Flo's home is an old boat moored by the beach. Things Couldn't Be Better!

programme.title: THE WAWIES
programme.desc: Wawaland is a tiny world within planet Earth. So small and light that it gets carried away by the wind. Right now, it could be flying over Tokyo, Paris, or the Atlantic Ocean, completely unseen by humans. In this magical place live The Wawieschubby and curious beings who are always asking questions and trying to make sense of the world around them and ours. Through Sha's far-away glasses, the Wawies can observe how humans behave on Earth and apply what they learn in their own world, sparking endless adventures that teach them, entertain them, help them explore their surroundings, and listen to themselves. They always stick together and never leave anyone behind. For example, this season, you might find them competing in their own version of Wawachef, escaping from some not-so-friendly monkeys, deciding to ban rules in their world forever, trying to calm down some feisty ants, training their patience to care for a garden, or figuring out which costume party is more fun: Halloween or Carnival. With each adventure, Sha, Opo, Aca, Bow, and Tok strive to understand, grow, and have fun. And along the way, they'll unintentionally create their own set of rules to live in a place where respect and harmony with their surroundings are key. With its playful and cheerful tone, Wawaland seeks to show children a different way of seeing thingshelping them appreciate the world around them and, most importantly, themselves.

programme.title: Doby & Disy: Exploring Journey
programme.desc: Adorable twin brother and sister, Doby & Disy, go on adventures in the magic forest together with their friends. They learn different colors, figures, songs and communication skills by solving various problems on the way.

programme.title: Hogie the Globehopper

programme.title: Princess Play Time
programme.desc: The proud Princess likes to do things her own way, but her antics are always joined by her restless brother, Prince, who tends to turn everything topsy-turvy. Any playtime in their room transforms into a fantastic journey through unusual worlds: the children arrange a picnic on the Moon, conduct a detective investigation in a toy city, or search for pirate treasures on islands! Although initially, the Princess and Prince seem to clash and compete, by the end, they always find joy in each other's company and that of their cherished dog, Bona.

programme.title: Shaq's Garage
programme.desc: Shaq's Garage - The Big Hike / Back to the Jurassic: Nine kids from the Boys & Girls Club go on a nature hike with Boone, Fleming, and Gronk. Gronk tries to follow Shaq's rule of staying on the trail, but one of his adventurous kids convinces him to go explore. When they get lost, they have to find their way back to the trail before nightfall. / Dawkins invites Biggie D, Fleming, and Himari to a viewing of a rare daylight lunar eclipse out in the wilderness. When a mysterious fog appears and transports them back to the Jurassic Era, the Paq must find their way back a fast as possible. What they didn't plan on was an extra passenger back to the present: a baby T-Rex!

programme.title: Shaq's Garage
programme.desc: Shaq's Garage - Raiders of the Lost Jewel / In Gronk We Trust: Professor Woodraven enlists the help of the Paq to find the famed Jewel of Kaheelee hidden somewhere in the wilds outside of Orlanta. Himari, Fleming, and Klaus jump at the chance, but not all is as it seems. When the Professor turns out to be an impostor, the Paw must race to save the precious jewel from the thief. / Shaq hosts a charity basketball game and tasks each member of the Paq with picking up items and helping set up for the event. Gronk begs Shaq to let him pick up the most important item, the winning trophy, and Shaq agrees. The rest of the Paq thinks it's a bad idea, but Gronk aims to prove them wrong. After getting distracted multiple times, Gronk has to dig deep to prove that Shaq's trust in his wasn't a mistake.

programme.title: Super Mario Bros 3
programme.desc: Super Mario Bros 3 - Oh Brother / Mighty Plumber: When Mario and Luigi get fed up with each other, Luigi soon finds himself having to save his brother from Koopa and Kooky. / Koopa brings TV hero Mighty Plumber to life and tricks him into robbing the Pipe Land Treasury.

programme.title: Snakebit
programme.desc: Lloyd, having been kicked out of the Hynobrai snake tribe unlocks a second tribe The Fangpyres to help him regain control. The Ninja are busy setting up their new HQ that Zane discovered, but are called to duty when the Fangpyres attack the village where Jay's family lives.

programme.title: LEGO Marvel Super Heroes: Avengers Reassembled
programme.desc: Finally, the Avengers confront Ultron and his Ultron Minions as they attack Avengers' Tower. Ultron's ultimate plan: use all the data/stuff they've stolen to free the newly rebuilt IRON LEGION, destroy the Avengers, and control the world. Tony dons the hastily repaired Hulk Buster Armor and it's on! It's a huge battle as the Avengers try to save their beloved HQ and defeat Ultron. Will they succeed? And, more importantly, can their party be saved after Ultron tries to take down their Tower?The Avengers must now fight one of their own, and they're not sure what to do! Cap and Thor lead the charge, but can't fend off Iron Man and Ultron's Minions. Meanwhile, Black Widow, Hawkeye and Hulk track down a signal that seems to be controlling Iron Man from a castle in the Little Sokovia section of New York. There they fight HYDRA and BARON VON STRUCKER and learn that YELLOWJACKET is the bug that infected Iron Man's suit for Ultron. To help break Iron Man free from Ultron's control, the Avengers call in their own bug...ANT MAN! The Avengers prepare for a party with a surprise guest when Ultron crashes the preparations by using mind control on Iron Man. While trying to rescue their leader, the rest of the team discovers that Baron Stucker, HYDRA, and Yellowjacket are in on Ultron's plans. While preparing for a party at Avengers' Tower, THE AVENGERS (IRON MAN, CAPTAIN AMERICA, BLACK WIDOW, HAWKEYE, THOR, HULK and VISION) notice Iron Man acting strangely. When Iron Man volunteers to go out and get more ice, they find it odd: when has Tony every volunteered to get anything? Suddenly, ULTRON appears on a screen: he's taken control of Iron Man! To make matters worse, Ultron takes over all the versions of Iron Man's armor and they fly off!

programme.title: The Power Of Merlok
programme.desc: When Jestro attacks a village on the far side of the Kingdom, the NEXO-Knights wonder how they'll get there. Then Macy remembers her dad has a royal RVmaybe they can mod that for their own, knightly use? Now the NEXO-Knights get rollingin THE FORTREX, their own ROLLING CASTLE! This great new HQ, which houses Merlok 2.0 as an operating system, will be how the knights move around Knighton and protect it from Jestro and his monsters. Speaking of the evil jester, in this episode Jestro uses some newly-made monsters to attack a town far from the capitol where he thinks he's safe from the Knights' reach. We see two parallel stories here: the Knights training, learning more about digital magic and getting organized as a team and at the same time we see Jestro making monsters, trying to learn how his powers work and talking to the Book. In the end, the Knights roll up in their castle and defeat Jestro and his marauding monsters. Lance thinks he should be the leader because he's a snot. Of course I'm the leaderI'm a Richmond.

programme.desc: Marine biologist Danni Washington hosts this series that explains how nature has helped to inspire technology that people use on a daily basis. The show also introduces viewers to people involved in creating innovations that are based on animals, including biologists who study the behavior of ants, architects designing "living buildings" and roboticists who are making their designs bigger and stronger based on animals.

programme.title: DOYOUNG 'Promise' MV
programme.desc: The title track Promise is an impressive ballad that begins with a minimal piano melody and gradually builds emotional depth as strings are added in the latter half. The lyrics, written by DOYOUNG, capture the feelings he couldn't easily express as his love grew deeper. Even if the confession comes late, it delivers a sincerity and emotional resonance stronger than any other words.

programme.title: EXO 'Crown' MV
programme.desc: 'Crown' is a hard dance song that fuses Atlanta trap drums, heavy metal guitars, and EDM synths to break genre boundaries. Siren effects and powerful vocals heighten the dramatic tension, while the lyrics liken a precious loved one to a crown coveted by many, conveying a desperate resolve to protect them at all costs.

programme.title: EXO 'REVERXE' Trailer
programme.desc: At the end of the trailer, the title of EXO's 8th full-length album, REVERXE, was finally revealed. Based on EXO's universe storyline the day we truly become one, a new world will open the album name reinterprets the word Reverse in EXO's own style, carrying the meaning a new world opens once again, further heightening anticipation.EXO has returned with a new trailer.

programme.title: RIIZE 'Fame' MV
programme.desc: The lyrics reflect RIIZE's artistic vision, delivering the message that what they truly seek is not fame, but the sharing of emotions and love.The bold, forward-driving rhythmic structure combined with the raw texture of electric guitar creates a dynamic surge of energy. RIIZE's second single Fame is the group's first venture into a rage-style hip-hop track, expressing their artistic ideals as emotional pop artists.

programme.title: Paul Desmond, Dave Brubeck & Joe Morello
programme.sub-title: Dave Brubeck and Paul Desmond live in Belgium
programme.desc: Dave Brubeck: Live in '64 boasts a beautifully filmed concert from one of the most beloved quartets in jazz history. Captured at the pinnacle of their power and popularity, Paul Desmond (alto sax), Joe Morello (drums), Eugene Wright (bass) and Dave Brubeck (piano) explore the trails they blazed into the realm of odd time signatures with Forty Days' and two versions of their groundbreaking hit Take Five', as well as forays into world music with a unique exploration of Koto Song'. Their intimate onstage chemistry and impeccable musicianship made the DBQ an award-winning jazz supergroup.

programme.title: Clark Terry
programme.sub-title: The Skymasters with Clark Terry - North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festival's staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1989, Dutch big band and radio orchestra The Skymasters took flight at the North Sea Jazz Festival in the Hague. Joining them is jazz legend Clark Terry on trumpet, flugelhorn and vocals in this exciting collaboration.

programme.title: Chet Baker
programme.sub-title: I Wouldn't Give a Cripple Crab a Crutch
programme.desc: This selection of unforgettable performances by some of the most iconic and influential male jazz and pop vocalists in history showcases these legends' unique essence. Delight in the expressive beauty and emotional depth of Chet Baker's rendition of Time After Time and You Don't Know What Love Is", recorded live in Brussels, Belgium in 1964 and in Rome, Italy in 1956 respectively. Revel in Frank Sinatra's iconic version of I've Got You Under My Skin". Immerse yourself in Dizzy Gillespie's dynamic performance of Let Me Outta Here, recorded live in Denmark in 1970. Enjoy Tony Bennett's unforgettable performance of It Don't Mean A Thing (If It Ain't Got That Swing) at London's majestic Royal Albert Hall in 1974. Let the haunting beauty of Nat King Cole's 1957 performance of Autumn Leaves and Louis Armstrong's performance of Basin Street Blues from 1959 delight you. Dean Martin's smooth vocal stylings will enthrall you as he performs the jazz standard Wrap Your Troubles In Dreams". Witness the electrifying energy of Sammy Davis Jr.'s performance of Too Close For Comfort. Join us for this unforgettable musical experience that you'll surely cherish!

programme.title: Charles Lloyd, Keith Jarrett, Cecil McBee & Jack DeJohnette
programme.sub-title: Charles Lloyd Quartet live in Brussels
programme.desc: Since 1960, the legendary saxophonist Charles Lloyd has lent his adventurous, lyrical sound to collaborations with likes of Cannonball Adderley, Keith Jarrett and The Beach Boys. His early and highly successful experiments blending jazz and rock music charted a path that led to the electric fusion of Miles Davis and The Headhunters, while his exploration of spirituality and transcendental meditation added a new depth to his sound. Lloyd moves from hard swing to subtle ballads, blending gorgeous textures and Eastern influences. This 1966 recording features Lloyd's quartet, accompanied by Keith Jarrett (piano), Cecil McBee (double bass) and Jack DeJohnette (drums), playing some of Lloyd's own compositions.

programme.title: Wycliffe Gordon
programme.sub-title: Wynton Marsalis: In This House, on This Morning
programme.desc: The final concert of the Mnchner Klaviersommer 1992 was by Wynton Marsalis and his septet. The 31-years-young star trumpeter performed one of his own jazz suites to the sold-out Philharmonie, under the title of In This House, On This Morning'. The concert covers every jazz style, in composition and improvisation, and in both small and grand forms. Marsalis's Septet was made up of Wess Anderson (alto saxophone), Wycliffe Gordon (trombone), Reginald Veal (bass), Herlin Riley (drums), Todd Williams (tenor saxophone), and Eric Reed (piano).

programme.title: Dizzy Gillespie, Tony Coe, Derek Humble & Billy Mitchell
programme.desc: American jazz trumpeter, composer, and bandleader Dizzy Gillespie (1917-1993) was one of the seminal figures of the bebop movement. He fuses all musical forms rooted in African culture, such as music from Cuba, Latin America and the Caribbean, into his music. On November 4, 1970 he played a concert in Denmark with the Kenny Clarke/Francy Boland Big Band, performing Con Alma, Brother K, Now Hear My Meanin', Manteca, Let Me Outta Here, and Things Are Here.

programme.title: Chet Baker
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Jamie Cullum
programme.desc: Watch the performance of Jamie Cullum live at Jazz Vienne, in 2017.

programme.title: Carlos Miguel Prieto & Orquesta Sinfnica de Minera
programme.desc: Mahler's Third Symphony, composed between 1895 and 1896, is an expansive, programmatic work that explores themes of nature, humanity, and spiritual ascent. It features a massive orchestra, a female choir, a children's choir, and a mezzo-soprano soloist, creating a vast soundscape depicting everything from nature's beauty to deeper philosophical questions about existence. The symphony is structured in six movements, moving from the "awakening of nature" to a spiritual conclusion, inspired by Nietzsche and folk poetry.

programme.title: Isabelle Faust
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Gabriela Montero, Youth Orchestra of the Americas & Carlos Miguel Prieto
programme.desc: Venezuelan pianist Gabriela Montero is accompanied by the Youth Orchestra of the Americas conducted by Carlos Miguel Prieto. On the program are Maurice Ravel's Piano Concerto in G Major, as well as two of Montero's own works: the Latin Concerto and Improvisations. The performance took place in one of the world's most beautiful concert halls, the Teatro del Lago in Frutillar, located in the middle of the Patagonian plains. The concert hall, which opened its doors in 2010, stands on the banks of Chile's second-largest lake overlooking a volcano that is capped with snow the entire year. In an accompanying interview, Montero speaks about composing, improvising, and performing works of her own alongside those of others. She discusses her home country of Venezuela, where she no longer performs for political reasons.

programme.title: Utrecht String Quartet
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Philippe Jordan & Orchestre de l'Opra national de Paris
programme.sub-title: Beethoven - Symphony No. 6 in F major, Op. 68
programme.desc: Swiss conductor Philippe Jordan and the Orchestre de l'Opra national de Paris recorded all of Ludwig van Beethoven's symphonies in 2014-2015. In this program, Jordan conducts Beethoven's Symphony No. 6 in F major, Op. 68, also known as the Pastoral Symphony. Beethoven wrote the work upon completion of his Symphony No. 5. Both symphonies premiered at the same legendary, all-Beethoven concert on December 22, 1808. Symphony No. 6 consists of five movements, of which the last three are played without a break. Each movement carries a title that suggests a scene from life in the countryside. The joyful atmosphere of the first three movements is interrupted by the violent fourth movement Thunder, Storm', as expressed by the piccolos, brass, and timpani. As the storm recedes at the end of the movement, the tranquility returns in the final movement. This performance was recorded at Opra Bastille in Paris, France, in 2015.

programme.title: Christine Nonbo Andersen, Tuva Semmingsen, David Bateson & Steffen Bruun
programme.desc: The Danish National Symphony Orchestra takes us on a spectacular symphonic space journey in an out-of-this-world concert program of film music. Under the direction of Dutch conductor Antony Hermus, the orchestra guides us through the musical universe, performing a selection of music from iconic sci-fi movies, such as Avatar, Gravity, Interstellar, and Star Wars, written by major composers such as John Williams, Hans Zimmer, and James Horner. Featured soloists in this concert are Tuva Semmingsen, Christine Nonbo Andersen, Steffen Bruun, and David Bateson. This performance was recorded at the DR Koncerthuset in Copenhagen, Denmark, in August 2021.

programme.title: Nikolay Lugansky
programme.sub-title: Piano works by Rachmaninoff, Beethoven & Glazunov
programme.desc: Russian pianist Nikolay Lugansky has received world-wide praise for his interpretations of the music of Sergei Rachmaninoff. In this wonderful recital, the great pianist presents works by the Russian Romantic composer as well as Ludwig van Beethoven and Alexander Glazunov. Lugansky opens his concert with Beethoven's Piano Sonata No. 14 in C-sharp minor, Op. 27 No. 2, Moonlight', followed by Alexander Glazunov's Piano Sonata No. 2 in E minor, Op. 75. Then Lugansky performs a selection of works by Rachmaninoff: Rachmaninoff's piano transcription of J. S. Bach's Partita No. 3 in E major a selection of tudes-Tableaux (Nos. 1, 2, 4, and 8, Op, 33, and Nos. 5 and 6, Op. 39) Lilac (Op. 21, No. 5) Prelude in C minor, Op. 23 No. 7 and Rachmaninoff's transcription of Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky's Lullaby (Op. 16 No. 1). This performance was recorded at the Tchaikovsky Concert Hall in Moscow, Russia, on June 4, 2021.

programme.title: Lady Gaga
programme.desc: Lady Gaga's performance at the iTunes Festival in London on September 1, 2013 marks the superstar's first full concert since the The Born This Way Ball. It is an eight song set containing the world premiere of seven tracks from her fourth album, ARTPOP: "Aura" "MANiCURE" "Artpop" "Jewels N' Drugs" ft. T.I., Too $hort and Twista "Sexxx Dreams", "Swine" and "I Wanna Be With You", a song that transformed into "Dope" for ARTPOP. During the concert, captured stunningly in HD, Gaga says that she's "a bit like Dorothy right now." The stage is her Kansas, the crowd is her family, and their reunion is pure magic. Lady Gaga, her dancers, and her band traverse through visual and musical themes of love, sex, violence, beauty, danger, empowerment, hustle, lust, and above all ART. Throughout, Gaga lays her heart bare for the audience and the cameras with every note sung and every word spoken.

programme.title: The Moody Blues
programme.desc: Celebrating the 50th anniversary of their landmark album, Days of Future Passed, The Moody Blues took to the road to perform the entire LP live. This film, capturing an electric evening at The Sony Centre, Toronto, where the band was joined on stage by a full orchestra for the first time ever, is the definitive performance of this seminal album. This spectacle of a show features stunning visuals and a unique narration performed by Jeremy Irons, transporting the audience and viewer to the psychedelic dream world of their classic record. Including the iconic hits Nights In White Satin and Tuesday Afternoon, this film truly pays homage to five decades of musical mastery. In this impressive yet intimate auditorium, The Moody Blues have never sounded better.
